question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to read film theory papers and understand them in regard to their historical background. I also learned how film theorist engage with one another over the years and changed ideologies with the advent of new technologies.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about major film theorists and their theories, including bell hooks, Bazin, Siegfried Kracauer and Erwin Panofsky. I learned how to write a paper about theory and I learned how to write and analyze films through various theoretical lenses.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Overall, I gained a new understanding for how film theory has emerged and changed over time. Before, I knew film theory only from bits and pieces that I had read (out of context) in other courses, but this course really helped to frame and contextualize theory as a whole. I most enjoyed the semiotics unit and how investigating cinema as a language influenced more modern theorists in thinking about the socio-political impacts of film.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned some historical background on cinema and early film, as well as more applied techniques like understanding film production/construction of shots/the effect they have and how to critically evaluate the position a film might have relative to its social/political context.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: From classical film theory to modern and contemporary film theory. Learned how to read theories and analyze films with the theories.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned the history and ideologies surrounding specific figures who have contributed to the development of film theory. I feel that my understanding of realism and identity as it relates to cinema strengthened after contextualizing films with in-class lectures. Finally, I had the opportunity to expand upon and adapt a paper to fit new criteria. I appreciated the space to rework and build a paper after the feedback stage as I often abandon papers once they are submitted.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

response_text: Through this media theory course, I gained a deep understanding of media's evolution, from foundational debates about writing and mediation to contemporary digital culture. question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: In this class, I learned how to think critically about the partisan divide in news and reframe my perspective. I learned how to read articles from opposing viewpoints with an open mind, and consider the bias in journalism. As someone who tries to  naively and impossibly avoid politics, I was also pushed out of my comfort zone to analyze partisan issues and consider the polarization of our news. Go narrow and deep.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I found that the course struck a perfect balance between class speakers and lecturing from Bill. And throughout both mediums, we were continuously empowered as students to ask questions and contribute to the discussion. Specifically, I think the class speakers are what helped to facilitate student learning. Not only did we hear from journalists and journalist experts, but we also heard from students like us who have ventured into journalism and encountered its problems from a fresh perspective. We heard from right-wing-leaning media owners. We heard from people who were impacted by right-wing media rabbit holes firsthand. Essentially, we got a variety of perspectives on the state of journalism, and this empowered us to use these testimonies to form our own conclusions.I also think all of the writing assignments clearly signaled relevance to the class, and they helped to apply and facilitate our learning. The individual prompts were also well-timed with what we were currently learning about or where we were in the course syllabus/timeline.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked Coates' teaching style - some film clips, some discussion, some lecture. I really liked how we had four in-class film screening days - we watched "The Conjuring," "Star Wars," "God's Not Dead," and "Kumaré." I liked our "mini review" assignments, where you basically produce a 7-minute film review using a class reading from that specific unit and you have to argue why it should be considered religious. The movies and clips we'd watch in class were more obviously religious, so this was a chance for us to get creative and find something that seems secular and apply it to our learnings.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course taught me so many useful skills, whether I decide to be a production manager for theater or not. Through the books we read, like Dan Heath's Upstream and Fearless Negotiating by Michael C. Donaldson, I learned how to preemptively stop problems from occurring, as well as how to negotiate and the most effective way to do so. Through our assignments, I learned how to organize and put together a calendar with important dates and events, as well as how to make a budget for both mainstage and repertory theater shows, which is a very useful skill. Knowing how to work with money and budget everything accurately is a skill important to all aspects of life.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to use excel, budgeting for up to four productions at a time, film. budgeting, theater budgeting, what a production manager is, communication styles, upstream/downstream thinking.

response_text: That the class is is a lot of outside work which may be cumbersome if you also have a class that eats up a lot of your time. Overall though, if you have any interest in theater or management the class is very interesting. If you have no background in theater the class does cover most of what you would need to know. The knowledge gained from the class can be applicable in areas outside of theater as well, so it is still worthwhile. The class is pretty chill and Thom is very approachable, plus you get to enjoy two comped shows, one at the DPAC with a Q&A session with the cast and crew after, and another with the Duke Theater Studies Show. Additionally, Thom lines up a good selection of guest speakers with quality inside knowledge and stories which were interesting every time. For those reasons I recommend the class.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I honed the skill of delving into unfamiliar topics, conducting thorough research, and crafting compelling stories based on them. The course consistently challenged us to write scripts on subjects we had no personal experience with or prior knowledge of. I gained proficiency in gathering both primary and secondary resources, covering historical contexts, technical details, and cultural backgrounds.Additionally, I mastered the art of writing within tight deadlines. With a weekly writing assignment, I learned to draft quickly and then focus on revisions rather than getting bogged down by details in the initial draft.Lastly, I cultivated the ability to provide constructive feedback to my peers in class. Engaging in script readings and discussions allowed me to refine my communication and comprehension skills while collaborating effectively with my classmates.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the method of reading everybody's work in a roundtable is very effective for this class. It allows the class to remain true to how screenplays are read and understood in the film industry but it also really allowed me to get an understanding of what was effective and what wasn't in a way that I didn't really get from just reading the work on the page. I also really liked that we got to stick with one idea for the majority of the semester. I don't often get to do that in other classes and it really allowed me to dive deep into a plot line and into the characters I was writing. I'm really proud of the final product.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to analyze movies in terms of incidents and dramatic action, adapting source material to screen and the many ways that can be done, and how to more accurately describe scenes in terms of action and meaning and uncover what the deeper meaning/main purpose is instead of objectively what happened.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: You learn an approach to screenwriting that emphasizes dramatic principles---understanding your main character's motivation, how to structure a plot around incidents, and three-act structure.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

course: THEATRST-284S-01 : HOW TO WRITE A HORROR MOVIE.THEATRST-284S-01.CINE-281S-01.ENGLISH-223S-01.
question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text:
This is such a unique course, and was a wonderful experience! I think the horror genre is fascinating, though I hadn't had much contact with it previously, and it's great that we got to engage with it in an academic context. Professor Bell was great, and I had so much fun with this class. There's a lot of writing, but I think that's a good part of the class. Making myself dive into writing for a new medium (as I had no previous experience with screenwriting) is what really started to give me a sense for what goes into a script.
Stay on top of your long script at the end, though. Checkpoints are built into the class, so don't get behind on them, because that 80 page script is very manageable if broken up over multiple weeks, but very scary if you've let it pile up!

response_text: This is such a unique class that I would absolutely recommend! Though this course I got to experience so many incredible things that have truly been standouts from my time at Duke. I’ll take the things I learned from this course to everything I do following this.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to write compelling and interesting stories and give and receive feedback. The latter two skills are critical to any kind of future in writing or collaborative work.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: dramatic action, how to craft stories that are compelling, and how to take critique from my peers

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I honed in on my screenwriting skills, learned how to write in play format, and learned how to be part of a constructive writer's room.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
Refining Screenplays and Plays
Doing character readings
writing plot

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I completed a substantial draft of a play that I had been planning for months. I learned how to listen to and selectively incorporate constructive feedback. I learned to persevere even when my writing was cringy or bad, and to then improve it or improve the next project.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: One thing I learned from this class is how to approach critiques when editing my writing. Before, I'd have a tendency to either completely disregard a critique (if I disagreed), or apply it in the same exact way ti was presented to me (if I agreed). Through this class, and through seeing how my classmates made edits to their writing, I learned how to take critiques into consideration while still fully making my own decisions about my work.I think that reading everyone's work helped me learn a lot about personal style and form, as there were so many different ways that we approached the same prompt that was really interesting, especially during the discussions after a reading

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I really liked the casting classmates in our pieces. I learned a lot from hearing my writing read aloud and the feedback I received.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: i liked the short weekly prompts in the beginning to get our creativity flowing, but then after that we were mostly left alone to work on our projects however we saw fit to develop them from week to week

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Bell is wonderful and facilitated a very safe and welcoming environment where everyone felt comfortable sharing personal stories and offering candid reactions and unfiltered feedback.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the way we would do readings was very interactive, and it really helped the whole class learn and bond

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The class was flexible enough to allow everyone to choose their own projects -- some started entirely new things, some kept working on existing projects. Students were encouraged to take the lead and ask the class for specific feedback if we wanted. The class was also structured enough to make sure everyone made progress and learned. There was a good balance.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: People are hilarious and the energy of the class and Neal was amazing. I always looked forward to class and spoke often of the material from the class outside of it. By far the best class I took this semester.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: reading writing aloud in class and not only telling our peers "I liked this", but explaining why we liked it or why it was good really helped me in crafting my own writing

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I never knew what we were going to read when I got to class and it was always a great time and interesting.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The fact that everyone had things they were excited to present, and everyone was excited to see what everyone else had written, that made the class great

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: We had to write new things every week and then critique each other's work. We had lively discussions and all became better writers and critics. Prof. Bell also gives helpful and detailed feedback if you email him and ask him to look at a specific script.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it if you enjoy creative writing and you want to have a space to explore storytelling. Take it even if you have very little experience; you'll learn a lot by having a structured time to write and explore yourself.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Prof. Bell is the absolute best. He provides really insightful critique of your writing and asks pointed questions to help you improve without it ever feeling like an attack or overwhelming. He also guides the class to explain why they liked a piece of writing (the characters felt 3D, the dramatic action was well-paced, etc) beyond just "I liked it" which is really helpful as a budding writer

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely take this class if you're interested at getting better at screenwriting or playwriting! I loved every minute of being in this class.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It's awesome, 100% recommend

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it! Prof. Bell is awesome, and the class size is such that we all developed a great rapport that made it fun to share our work.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Being able to work towards one final project throughout the semester way incredibly rewarding, and it was definitely the highlight of my week this semester. Take this class if you can, you will not regret it!

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: An understanding of African American Independent Cinema- understanding its development in dialogue and opposition with mainstream cinema, understanding the 4 phases of it, and critically watching these films for their subliminal messages and subtext.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. history of african american participants on screen and behind the camera
2. four categorical waves of independent african american cinema
3. how to write both critically and analytically about films

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the history of films, how Black films influenced many social movements, and how Black filmmakers persevered.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about the origins of independent African American cinema, how to write and analyze a movie, and the different eras that independent AA cinema have evolved and moved through.
